Additional Resources

Explore these external resources to deepen your understanding of Media and Communication. These links complement the content in our academic roadmap.

Academic Journals and Publications

  • Journal of Communication - Leading journal in communication research
  • Human Communication Research - Focuses on theory and research in human communication
  • International Journal of Communication - Global perspectives on communication
  • Journalism & Mass Communication Quarterly - Research in journalism and mass communication

Professional Organizations

  • International Communication Association (ICA) - Global network for communication scholars
  • Association for Education in Journalism and Mass Communication (AEJMC) - Focuses on journalism and mass communication education
  • National Association of Broadcasters (NAB) - Represents the interests of free, over-the-air radio and television broadcasters

Online Learning Platforms

  • Coursera - Communication Courses - Free and paid courses from top universities
  • edX - Communication - Online courses from institutions like MIT and Harvard
  • Khan Academy - Humanities - Free resources on various topics including media and communication

Media Literacy Resources

  • Media Literacy Project - Resources for teaching and learning about media
  • Common Sense Media - Reviews and advice on media for families
  • MediaSmarts - Canadian centre for digital and media literacy

News and Current Events

  • Nieman Lab - Focuses on the future of journalism
  • Poynter Institute - Nonprofit school for journalism and media
  • Columbia Journalism Review - Critiques and analysis of journalism

Note: This list is not exhaustive. If you know of other valuable resources, please consider contributing them to our repository!
